item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 22, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The essays of Michel de Montaigne online (12 points | 3 comments)
2. Scathing book reviews of 2024 (23 points | 4 comments)
3. Slow deployment causes meetings (2015) (31 points | 8 comments)
4. A data table thousands of years old (2020) (143 points | 44 comments)
5. Keeping a Changelog at Work (2020) (55 points | 20 comments)
6. City Roads: A tool to draw all roads in a city at once (171 points | 28 comments)
7. Query Apple's FindMy network with Python (354 points | 150 comments)
8. Rosetta 2 creator leaves Apple to work on Lean full-time (90 points | 26 comments)
9. An epitome of electricity and galvanism (1809) (3 points | 1 comment)
10. Ideas from "A Philosophy of Software Design" (102 points | 58 comments)
11. Dividing unsigned 8-bit numbers (115 points | 55 comments)
12. How we made our AI code review bot stop leaving nitpicky comments (112 points | 64 comments)
13. Towards a new kind of science and technology (13 points | 2 comments)
14. JEP 483: Ahead-of-Time Class Loading and Linking (62 points | 9 comments)
15. Enum of Arrays (74 points | 17 comments)

18. Fault Report – and alternative to Result in F# (12 points | 3 comments)

21. Translating 10M lines of Java to Kotlin (99 points | 81 comments)
22. Train a Mnist VAE with C and CUDA (20 points | discuss)
23. Spherical Harmonics (33 points | 32 comments)
24. Show HN: Demo of my web game about social persuasion (63 points | 27 comments)
25. A curious case of O(N^2) behavior which should be O(N) (2023) (62 points | 15 comments)
26. Talking over a wall changed my direction as a programmer (78 points | 33 comments)
27. Introducing S2 (260 points | 134 comments)
28. AI Is the Black Mirror (15 points | 1 comment)
29. Grammarly acquires Coda (106 points | 66 comments)
30. Cqd: Colour my __dir__ please (21 points | 3 comments)
